comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: At six months, Virginia June Nay of Battle Creek MI won in the youngest category at a Better Babies Contest of 1914, a eugenics-inspired event, "because she was already teething and her fontanel had closed quickly. Her appearance, which was pleasant, was not a factor in her success."--Dorothy Nelkin and M. Susan Lindee, The DNA Mystique: The Gene as a Cultural Icon (University of Michigan Press 2004): p. 29. This photo was featured in the Proceedings of the National Conference on Race Betterment (vol. 1), 1914: p. 620. books.google.com/books?id=XAjiAAAAMAAJ
